docs: PriceActionSystem handles price component initialization and updates
This system allows entities to:
- Initialize price components with proper values
- Enable price updates for components
- Update prices based on market dynamics
All currency values use 6 decimal places, where 1,000,000 = $1.
For example, BTC at $60,000 would be stored as 60,000,000,000.

instructions.name: execute
docs: Main execution function for the PriceActionSystem

types.name: BoltMetadata
docs: Metadata for the component.

types.name: Price
docs: Price component that tracks market values and price history
This component is attached to entities that have market value, such as currencies and assets.
It tracks current price, historical prices, and price change parameters.
Price changes can be influenced by market activity and time-based fluctuations.

fields.name: current_price
docs: Current price in USDC (base currency)

fields.name: previous_price
docs: Previous price for calculating price change

fields.name: last_update_time
docs: Timestamp of last price update

fields.name: min_price
docs: Minimum price allowed

fields.name: max_price
docs: Maximum price allowed

fields.name: volatility
docs: Volatility factor (100 = 1%, 1000 = 10%, etc.)

fields.name: update_frequency
docs: Price update frequency in seconds

fields.name: price_type
docs: Type of the priced entity (uses same enum as Ownership component)

fields.name: price_updates_enabled
docs: Whether price updates are currently enabled

fields.name: price_trend
docs: Price trend direction (-100 to +100, where 0 is neutral)

fields.name: price_history
docs: Array of historical prices (most recent first, max 24 entries)

fields.name: history_index
docs: Index for circular price history array

fields.name: supply_factor
docs: Supply factor affecting price (10000 = neutral)

fields.name: demand_factor
docs: Demand factor affecting price (10000 = neutral)
